definition: to collude with/to collaborate with/to gang up with
to attract/to arouse/to tick/to strike out/to delineate/to collude/variant of 鉤|钩[gou1], hook
(of a plant) to produce (fruit or seeds)/Taiwan pr. [jie2]
knot/sturdy/bond/to tie/to bind/to check out (of a hotel)

sentences.english: A young policeman has been accused of conspiring with a gang of criminals.
sentences.chinese: 一名年輕警察被指控與一個犯罪集團相勾結。

sentences.english: He didn't get any money for this. He didn't go to a foreign government.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有拿情報來賣錢，沒有勾結外國政府。

sentences.english: Necklacing was also used to punish members of the black community who were perceived as collaborators with the apartheid regime.
sentences.chinese: 也用在黑人團體中和種族隔離政權勾結的成員身上。

sentences.english: Was it possible that the plaintiffs had colluded with Beristain to handpick the interviewees?
sentences.chinese: 是否有可能是原告勾結貝斯坦並精心挑選了受訪者？

sentences.english: And there has been a recent crackdown on the corrupt nexus between developers and officials.
sentences.chinese: 近期政府又打擊了一起官商勾結的腐敗問題。

sentences.english: Any one who collaborates should be shot.
sentences.chinese: 與敵人勾結者一律槍決。

sentences.english: The prime minister YuWenHuaJi in order to take the throne with collude with the turks.
sentences.chinese: 丞相宇文化及爲了奪取皇位同突厥暗中勾結。

sentences.english: This idiom is used to describe doing evil things in collusion with others.
sentences.chinese: 狼狽爲奸這個成語比喻壞人互相勾結起來幹壞事。

sentences.english: In part four, I study the applicant and so on defrauds insurance money together with the insurance -company' staff.
sentences.chinese: 第四部分，內外勾結騙取保險公司保險金的定性問題。

sentences.english: Therefore, the government said that Anwar colludes with US, is I not clear matter.
sentences.chinese: 因此，政府說安華勾結美國，是我所不明白的事。

sentences.english: Several journalists were found to be hand and glove with enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 有幾位新聞記者被查出與敵特勾結。

sentences.english: Several high-ranking diplomats were found to be hand and glove with enemy agents.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個高級外交官被發現與敵方人員勾結。

sentences.english: Human society is a struggle between good and evil.
sentences.chinese: 社會乃善與惡的鬥爭，惡人易以利害互相勾結。

sentences.english: The police were corrupt and were operating in collusion with the drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警察腐敗，與那夥毒品販子內外勾結。

sentences.english: The result is collusion of power and capital, which has led to the current situation.
sentences.chinese: 結果就會造成力量與權力的勾結，導致目前的狀況。

sentences.english: It's said the drug pushers stand in with the police.
sentences.chinese: 聽說毒販都和警方相勾結。

definition: to rope in/fig. to involve sb/to entice
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to entrap/to frame/to plant false evidence against sb
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
